author: AOL Staff
title: Florida family uses Apple AirTag to locate stolen luggage from a North Carolina airport to suspect's home
text: Florida family uses Apple AirTag to locate stolen luggage from a North Carolina airport to suspect's home A family vacation took a detour for a Miami family after their luggage was stolen while traveling for Christmas break, but thanks to technology, they were able to [recover their stolen property.](https://www.foxnews.com/category/us/crime) "I wanted justice," Catherine Gavino told Queen City News on Tuesday. Gavino and her family were traveling [from the Miami area](https://www.foxnews.com/category/us/miami) to the Carolinas through Charlotte Douglas International Airport in North Carolina, where the crime took place. When the family [landed in Charlotte](https://www.foxnews.com/category/us/us-regions/southeast/north-carolina) on Friday afternoon, they told [FOX 46 Charlotte](https://fox59.com/news/national-world/i-wanted-justice-airtags-used-to-track-stolen-luggage-from-charlotte-airport-to-suspects-home/) that they were unable to find one of their suitcases at the baggage claim. [CANADA GOOSE JACKETS ARE TARGETS FOR THIEVES, DC POLICE RECOMMEND AIRTAGS FOR OWNERS OF EXPENSIVE OUTERWEAR](https://www.foxnews.com/media/canada-goose-jackets-targets-thieves-dc-police-recommend-airtags-owners-expensive-outerwear) However, thanks to Catherine's new Apple AirTag, the search began for the stolen luggage. Gavino said when she pulled up her cellphone, [the AirTag hidden](https://www.foxnews.com/category/tech/companies/apple) inside her parents' luggage showed it was on Interstate 85 and on its way west toward Gastonia. The Gavino family then gathered the rest of their bags, picked up their rental car and began to follow the AirTag to a neighborhood, but said they were unable to find the exact location. [MAN USES APPLE AIRTAG TO TRACK, RECOVER BMW STOLEN FROM HIS DRIVEWAY: 'PRETTY INSANE'](https://www.foxnews.com/world/man-uses-apple-airtag-track-recover-bmw-stolen-from-his-driveway) According to Gavino, AirTag had stopped displaying its location after a certain point. The Gavino family canceled the search, but resumed it on Christmas Day, in hopes of having better luck. After dropping off family members back at the airport, Gavino checked her AirTag location one more time, which revealed a location for a house in Gastonia. According to Gavino, after contacting the police, she not only found the house, but also their missing luggage along with another suitcase of a different victim whose luggage was stolen from the airport. [PROS AND CONS OF TRACKING YOUR LOST ITEMS USING APPLE AIRTAG VERSUS TILE TRACKERS](https://www.foxnews.com/tech/pros-cons-tracking-your-lost-items-using-apple-airtag-versus-tile-trackers) Gavino told Queen City News that Gastonia police informed her that "someone else called with the same issue. And they also had an AirTag." Once her family's luggage was recovered, to their dismay, almost everything was gone. "Police believe they may have sold the clothes for money, who knows," Catherine explained. "These are my parents, coming to the mountains for a North Carolina view, so for this to happen made me sad, which was all the more reason to go after them…I wouldn’t have found them without this AirTag." According to police records, the suspect was arrested and charged with multiple theft crimes, including a drug charge, and is being held on a $10,000 bond. The Gastonia Police Department did not immediately respond to Fox News Digital’s request for comment. Original article source: [Florida family uses Apple AirTag to locate stolen luggage from a North Carolina airport to suspect's home](https://www.foxnews.com/us/florida-family-uses-apple-airtag-locate-stolen-luggage-north-carolina-airport-suspects-home)

author: Mike Gooding
title: Report spotlights severe staffing shortages VA medical centers face across clinical occupations
text: WASHINGTON — Taking care of America's military veterans is a sacred obligation. The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) has stated its top priority is providing the world-class care that veterans deserve. One key aspect of that is having the medical staff in place to fulfill the mission, as VA Secretary Denis McDonough told lawmakers back in May. "No single investment is more critical to the veterans we serve and VA's future than the people we hire and retrain," he said. But a new report raises questions about the department's ability to meet its mission. The VA's Office of the Inspector General last week released its annual staffing shortage report. Of the 139 facilities surveyed, 137 reported at least one severe occupational staffing shortage. The five clinical occupations with the most frequent severe shortages are psychology, practical nurse, psychiatry, medical technologist and primary care. The report stated that 86% of facilities reported severe shortages of medical officers, and 82% reported a severe shortage of nurses. But the VA points out it had a record year for hiring in 2023, bringing on 61,000 new employees, and the department recorded 116 million health care appointments, surpassing the old record by 3 million. In a statement to 13 News Now, VA Press Secretary Terrence Hayes said: "While VA needs to, and continues to, strategically hire in key areas and locations, the VA has the nationwide staffing total we need to deliver for our nation's veterans."

organizations.name: va's office of the inspector general

author: Par Journal L'Union
title: Pas de salaires, rayons vides\u2026 Les salari\u00e9s du magasin \u00ab\u00a0Leader Price by Casino\u00a0\u00bb de Montmirail n\u2019y croient
text:
Pas de salaires, rayons vides… Les salariés du magasin « Leader Price by Casino » de Montmirail n’y croient plus
Il y a encore quelques heures, l’enseigne affichait en gros les lettres « Leader Price by Casino », dans le centre-ville de Montmirail. Au petit matin, ce vendredi 29 novembre 2024, elle a disparu. « Elle nous a vendu du rêve », lâche un salarié. Mais que se passe-t-il dans ce magasin ?
« Nous n’avons plus de livraisons depuis le mois d’août. Attendre le client pour rien et voir que les clients ne viennent plus parce que le magasin est vide, cela joue sur le moral », décrit un employé qui tient à garder l’anonymat car les relations avec la direction « sont tendues ». « Mon collègue et moi avons reçu des propos délicats de la part de la direction », explique-t-il. Actuellement, certains salariés sont en arrêt de travail ou en arrêt maladie, car ils ne supportent plus de travailler dans un magasin vide, sans chauffage et sans livraisons.
Des salariés pas payés depuis octobre
Les salariés, en « état de choc traumatique », n’auraient pas reçu de fiches de paie pour le mois de septembre 2024. Ils n’auraient pas eu de salaire, ni de fiche de paie pour le mois d’octobre. « Les fêtes approchent, nous sommes dans le rouge. Les banques nous contactent et nous ne savons pas quoi faire. Ça va être compliqué de mettre des cadeaux sous le sapin. Ce n’est pas acceptable », se désole une employée.
« Les fêtes approchent, nous sommes dans le rouge. Les banques nous contactent et nous ne savons pas quoi faire »
Les cinq salariés de l’entreprise veulent récupérer ce qui leur appartient. « Nous avons contacté un syndicat, mais nous vivons avec la peur au ventre. Début juillet, il y a eu une confrontation avec cette personne et un de ses accompagnants. Elle a su nous rassurer et nous mettre en confiance. Mais à l’heure actuelle, nous n’avons aucune information. Nous n’y croyons plus », se désole une salariée.
Par ailleurs, plusieurs signalements ont été faits auprès de la directrice concernant l’état sanitaire du magasin. « Le magasin est vieux et travailler dans ce local devient dangereux », poursuit l’employée.
Le magasin racheté en juin 2024
Depuis le 11 juin 2024, le magasin a été racheté par une indépendante, Imène Aoufi. Cependant, certains salariés y travaillent depuis plus de 25, voire presque 30 ans. « Nous lui avons fait part de notre mécontentement sur les livraisons et sur les prix des produits qui sont trop chers. Nous avons déjà deux autres enseignes concurrentes à Montmirail. Beaucoup de nos clients sont des personnes âgées sans véhicule, et elles venaient chez nous », explique un autre salarié. Tous les clients ont fini par partir en voyant les rayons vides. « Il n’y a plus de produits frais, juste un tout petit peu de surgelés que nous avons étalés au maximum », indique-t-il.
C’est le délégué syndical de la CGT, [Steve Boucly](https://www.lunion.fr/id575701/article/2024-03-04/montmirail-le-candidat-steve-boucly-abandonne-la-course-lelection-municipale), qui révèle cette affaire. Habitant à [Montmirail](https://www.lunion.fr/3082/locations/montmirail-marne), il se souvient bien de l’enseigne encore en place à son départ vers 4 h 30 ce vendredi. « Les salariés se sont aperçus dans la matinée que la direction avait retiré l’enseigne lumineuse de la façade. Nous leur avons mis à disposition un avocat, vu qu’ils n’ont pas de salaire. Mais un avocat, il faut le payer », ajoute Steve Boucly.
Au niveau de la municipalité, la situation a été découverte la semaine dernière, lors de la collecte de la [Banque alimentaire](https://www.lunion.fr/id665952/article/2024-11-29/55-tonnes-de-denrees-recoltees-la-collecte-de-la-banque-alimentaire-dans-le-sud). « Une de mes adjointes m’a expliqué qu’elle n’irait pas là-bas car il n’y avait rien à vendre. Étonné, je suis allée voir et tout était vide », indique le maire Étienne Dhuicq. C’est à ce moment-là que l’édile a rencontré les salariés et les a écoutés.

author: TNN
title: Vanmahotsav Drive: Vanmahotsav drive with multiple departments collaboration | - Times of India
text: Chandigarh: In a bid to promote tree plantation outside the forest area this Vanmahotsav, the forest department has roped in different government departments and agencies to plant saplings on their land.“The green cover of City Beautiful has increased significantly over time with continued efforts of all greening agencies and support of the people of Chandigarh. One focus area is to increase trees outside forest area. This year, a special drive has been taken up by the department to reach out to other government departments of Chandigarh, organisations, institutions, schools/ colleges etc for plantation of trees within their premises,” said a UT forest department official.Several meetings were held with departments concerned to discuss the plantation plan between April and June this year. Joint site inspections by nodal officers of stakeholder departments and the forest department were conducted to ascertain the suitability of the site and species for plantation during the monsoon. The plantation drive will be launched by the UT administrator under the campaign “Ek Ped Maa ke Naam.” They will start the drive by planting a sapling at Punjab Raj Bhawan on July 5. tnnWe also published the following articles recentlyCM Yogi plants sapling as part of plantation campaignRead about CM Yogi Adityanath's strong support for PM Modi's 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam' campaign to plant trees for environmental conservation. Learn about the 54 crore plants raised in state nurseries and the distribution of moringa plants to PM Awas Yojana beneficiaries.111493060TTD and forest department to chalk out long-term measures to tackle wildlife intrusion into pedestrian routes at TirumalaLearn about the collaborative efforts of Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams and the forest department to manage wildlife intrusions on pedestrian routes to Tirumala. Measures like trap cameras and improved tracking systems are being implemented to ensure devotee safety.111463229Bareilly division to launch three-point plantation program on July 1Discover the Bareilly division's new three-point plantation program launching on July 1. With a focus on community involvement and spiritual elements, the program aims to plant 1.83 crore saplings this year. Free Tulsi and Ma Ke Naam plants will be provided to promote environmental care and well-being.111367475

author: VNExplorer
title: Thierry Henry names Arsenal star who could have scored 'two or three' against West Ham
text:
Thierry Henry called out Arsenal’s poor finishing following Thursday’s loss (Picture: Amazon)
Thierry Henry has named the Arsenal star who could have scored ‘two or three’ during Thursday’s 2-0 defeat to West Ham at the Emirates.
The Gunners missed the chance to go top of the Premier League following goals from Tomas Soucek and Konstantinos Mavropanos.
Soucek’s opener was highly controversial – as the ball appeared to go out of play in the build-up – and it could have got even worse for the north Londoners had David Raya not denied Said Benrahma from the penalty spot after Declan Rice hacked down Emerson inside the box.
Arsenal’s wastefulness in front of goal was also evident, with Mikel Arteta’s team having 77 touches in the opposition box, the most on record in a single Premier League match for a team who failed to score.
Following Arsenal’s defeat, which could be costly in the Premier League title race, Gunners legend Henry feels that Gabriel Jesus could have scored multiple goals.
The Brazil international forward has registered just three goals across 14 top-flight appearances this term.
‘You knew Arsenal were going to get chances,’ Henry told Amazon Prime after the match.
Gabriel Jesus was wasteful in front of goal as Arsenal lost 2-0 (Picture: Getty)
‘Sometimes it hits the post, there is a leg on the line or it is not finishing well.
‘Gabriel Jesus could have scored two or three. He didn’t. But you have to give credit to West Ham. Not conceding at the Emirates is something amazing.’
Henry also hailed three West Ham stars as well as the east Londoners’ recruitment after reinvesting the £105m they received from selling Declan Rice this summer.
‘Edson Alvarez, not a lot of people talk about him, what he brings to the team is solidity,’ Henry added.
‘What Jarrod Bowen did today to gain free-kicks, hold the ball and allow the team to breathe was vital.
‘The amount of times Mohammed Kudus kept the ball and allowed his team to play higher was second to none. They have done very well with the money they got from the transfer of Declan Rice [to Arsenal].’
Never miss a beat throughout the season or transfer window with weekly Arsenal news updates, exclusives and analysis. Sign up to Metro.co.uk’s Club Metro newsletter

author: TNN
title: Heavy Rain: Heavy Rain Forecast For South Tn | Madurai News - Times of India
text: Madurai: Following the heavy rain warning issued by the India Meteorological Department for Kanyakumari, Tirunelveli, Ramanathapuram, and Tuticorin districts on December 31 and January 1, 2024, the district administrations in Tuticorin and Tirunelveli have alerted people to be cautious, especially those living along the banks of the Thamirabarani .The IMD noted the prevalence of moderate Northeasterlies/easterlies in the lower tropospheric levels over the region. As a result, light to moderate rain is expected to occur at one or two places over Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal areas on Friday, with additional forecasts for light to moderate rains at a few places over South Tamil Nadu, and one or two places over North Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal areas on Saturday.The IMD has specifically issued a heavy rain warning for one or two places in Kanyakumari, Tirunelveli, Ramanathapuram, and Tuticorin districts on December 31 and January 1.The Western Ghats in Tirunelveli district experienced torrential rainfall on Wednesday night, with Oothu in Manjolai area recording 500 mm of rainfall by Thursday morning. Similarly, Nalumukku recorded 400 mm, and Kakkachi and Manjolai areas recorded 300 mm of rainfall. In anticipation of heavy rains, the Tirunelveli district administration initiated the release of water from Manimutharu, Papanasam, and Servalaru reservoirs. The collective discharge from these reservoirs was 2,000 cusecs on Thursday morning, increasing to 5,936 cusecs by 5 pm. The district collector mentioned that the discharge would be further increased based on rainfall and dam inflow.In Tuticorin, the district administration directed all department officials to be present at their offices on December 30, 31, and January 1 without fail. Departments including revenue, local administration, agriculture, dairy and fisheries, health, Tangedco, highways, public works, municipal, and town panchayat were instructed to ensure staff attendance. The statement from district collector G Lakshmipathy emphasized that all tahsildars and block development officers should be at their stations and ensure the presence of their subordinates on these days.We also published the following articles recently`6k/ration card for flood-affected in Tirunelveli, Tuticorin, says CMCM Stalin announced Rs 6,000 per ration card for flood-affected districts, requested flood relief funds for Chennai and southern Tamil Nadu from NDRF, explained the allocation of state and central funds, criticized governor's lack of action, assured timely evacuation during dam water release, distributed relief materials in Tuticorin and Tirunelveli, instructed officials to expedite relief work.106197467Kerala govt to extend helping hand to rain-hit Tamil NaduKerala government to provide kits to flood-hit Tamil Nadu families; kits include rice, salt, sugar, wheat, sunflower oil, bucket, soap, toothpaste, comb, towel; items being collected at Disaster Management Authority office; southern districts of Tamil Nadu affected.106217142Tourists flock to tourist places in Alluri district: Continuous holidays also a reasonContinuous holidays witnessed heavy tourist flow to Araku, Paderu, Lammasingi, and other spots. Tribal pockets experience shivering cold with temperatures dipping to single digits Celsius. Tourists flock to Cheruvulavenam, known as Meghalakonda (clouds hill) near Lammasingi. All hotels and lodges in Araku and Paderu are jam-packed. Lammasingi becomes a campfire competition ground with tent accommodations filled in various spots. Around 4000 people visit Kottapalli waterfalls and Borra caves.106272297

author: French Presstv
title: La résistance des Palestiniens et des Gazaouïs restera à jamais gravée dans les annales de l’Histoire (Leader)
text: Le Leader de la Révolution islamique, l'Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei a accordé, ce lundi 6 mai, une audience aux responsables iraniens en charge des affaires de pèlerinage du Hajj accompagnés de quelques futurs pèlerins des saintes villes de La Mecque et de Médine situées en Arabie saoudite. « Cette année, notre Hajj sera un Hajj de désaveu des mécréants conformément à toutes les directives que le prophète Abraham nous a enseignées », a souligné le Leader de la Révolution islamique. « Ce qui se passe aujourd’hui à Gaza et en Palestine, ces attaques barbares des sionistes d’une part et la résistance du peuple musulman de Gaza de l’autre, tout cela restera à jamais gravé dans les annales de l’Histoire. Et cela tracera la voie de l’avenir de l’Humanité. » « Le régime sioniste n’aurait pas osé commettre des actes barbares contre les Palestiniens sans le soutien des États-Unis », a souligné l’Ayatollah Khamenei. « Il n’est pas possible de se comporter avec gentillesse envers quelqu’un qui est complice d’un meurtre et qui soutient l’assassin. » Et le Leader de poursuivre : « Un des éléments le plus essentiel du Hajj réside dans la question de l’unité, de la solidarité, de l’égalité et de l’union avec tous les musulmans. La volonté divine consiste à ce que tous les musulmans du monde entier se rapprochent, se connaissent, s’unissent et qu’ils prennent des décisions communes. C’est précisément ce qui manque aujourd’hui au monde musulman. Si cela se concrétise, ce sera non seulement un grand pas bénéfique pour le monde de l’Islam mais aussi pour l’Humanité entière. Et la prélude est la levée des différences d’ordre éthique. » « La Palestine a besoin aujourd’hui plus que jamais du monde de l’Islam. Il est vrai que la République islamique n’a pas attendu [le soutien] des autres [pays] et qu’elle ne l’attendra certes pas non plus à l’avenir. Certes si les mains puissantes des nations et des gouvernements musulmans viennent en appui à ce peuple, cela aura une plus grande portée et personne n’osera plus agir de cette façon sauvage pour traiter le peuple palestinien. C’est un devoir à tout un chacun. »

author: Europa Press
title: La Cartera Real llega al Alcázar de Jerez (Cádiz) para recoger las cartas a los Reyes Magos de los niños de la ciudad
text:
JEREZ DE LA FRONTERA (CÁDIZ), 26 (EUROPA PRESS) La Cartera Real, encarnada por Laura Barba, ha llegado este jueves al Alcázar de Jerez, donde permanecerá hasta el próximo 3 de enero para recoger las cartas a los Reyes Magos de los niños de la ciudad.
Tras un recorrido por las calles del centro de Jerez, la alcaldesa, María José García-Pelayo, acompañada de miembros del Gobierno Municipal y de los representantes jerezanos de los Reyes Magos, ha sido la encargada de recibir a la emisaria de los Reyes de Oriente y entregarle las llaves del Alcázar, según ha detallado el Consistorio jerezano en una nota.
La Cabalgata de la emisaria de Melchor, Gaspar y Baltasar ha recorrido de forma este jueves las calles del centro, saludando a todas las familias que salieron a su encuentro y anunciando la llegada de Sus Majestades de Oriente. Un desfile en el que miles de niños han recibido con ilusión a la emisaria de los Reyes.
La Cartera Real ha invitado a todas las familias de Jerez a visitar el Alcázar para que los niños entreguen sus cartas a los Reyes. La Cartera y su séquito estarán los días 28, 29 y 30 de diciembre y 2 y 3 de enero en horario de 10,00 a 14,00 horas y de 17,30 a 20,30 horas. Por segundo año consecutivo, y como parte de las medidas para una Navidad más inclusiva y accesible, la Cartera Real ha establecido dos días para que las personas con discapacidad puedan entregar su carta a los Reyes Magos con unas condiciones más favorables.
El día 2 de enero, a las 16,00 horas atenderá a las personas con trastornos del espectro autista y a sus familias. El día 3 de enero, a partir de las 16,00 horas, atenderá a las personas con otras discapacidades que quieran entregar sus cartas sin necesidad de hacer colas.
Para concertar estas visitas a la Cartera Real es necesario inscribirse a través de la web ' www.omad.jerez.es ', indicando los datos de la persona con discapacidad, para posteriormente esperar un SMS con la confirmación de la visita y una resolución firmada por correo electrónico para el acceso sin colas a la puerta de El Alcázar. De este modo, la mensajera de los Reyes Magos pondrá el colofón a su labor de días atrás, de recoger las peticiones que por escrito le han entregado los más pequeños de los distintos distritos de la ciudad.

author: Guillermo Peris Peris
title: Israel reconoce el "fracaso" de matar a tres rehenes pero dice que los militares estaban "en alerta máxima"
text: Viajes y Lugares Tienda Siglo XXI Grupo Siglo XXI 19º ANIVERSARIO Fundado en noviembre de 2003 Opinión » Firmas y Blogs Viñetas Cartas Encuestas España Mundo Economía » Productividad Automóviles Empresas Deportes » Fútbol Baloncesto Tenis Motor Ciclismo Cultura » Cine Televisión y Medios Música Libros Sociedad » Moda y Tendencias Turismo y Gastronom. Ciencia » Salud Psicología Tecnología Mundo Israel reconoce el "fracaso" de matar a tres rehenes pero dice que los militares estaban "en alerta máxima" Agencias @DiarioSigloXXI jueves, 28 de diciembre de 2023, 21:17 h (CET) MADRID, 28 (EUROPA PRESS) Las Fuerzas de Defensa de Israel (FDI) han concluido la investigación del incidente de mediados de diciembre, cuando un batallón en el barrio gazatí de Shejaiya mató por error a tres de los rehenes tomados por el Movimiento de Resistencia Islámica (Hamás) durante su ofensiva del 7 de octubre, origen de la actual guerra en Oriente Próximo. Según ha relatado el jefe del Estado Mayor israelí, el teniente general Herzi Halevi, aquel episodio fue "un evento difícil con resultados muy difíciles". "Las FDI fracasaron en su misión de rescatar a los rehenes en este evento", ha manifestado el alto mando militar, según informaciones recogidas por el diario 'The Times of Israel'. "Toda la cadena de mando se siente responsable de este difícil acontecimiento, lamenta este resultado y comparte el dolor de las familias de los tres rehenes", ha añadido Halevi; mientras que el informe final de las FDI argumenta que los militares implicados en este suceso "estaban en estado de alerta máxima". De hecho, la investigación de lo ocurrido ha concluido que el batallón desplegado en la zona no tenía "suficiente conciencia" sobre la posibilidad de encontrarse con rehenes, por lo que la misión no se trataba de un operativo especial para liberar a secuestrados por la milicia palestina. "Los soldados de las FDI involucrados en el incidente experimentaron situaciones de combate complejas en los días anteriores al incidente y estaban en estado de alerta máxima ante una amenaza", reza el informe final, que señala que las tropas fueron víctimas de "engaños" por parte de milicianos de Hamás, que llegaron incluso a tratar de introducirlos en pozos y edificios repletos de explosivos. Así pues, el Ejército israelí ha detallado que, en el marco de "intensos combates" en Shejaiya, un soldado del 17º Batallón de la Brigada Bislamach abrió fuego contra tres personas que había identificado erróneamente como una amenaza. Dos de estas tres personas murieron en el acto a causa de los disparos, mientras que la tercera logró huir. Los comandantes presentes en la zona ordenaron cesar el fuego para poder identificar a esta tercera persona, que al cabo del tiempo gritó desde un edificio cercano pidiendo ayuda en hebreo. Las tropas presentes instaron a esta persona a avanzar hacia ellos, pero en ese momento otros militares que no habían escuchado la orden de alto el fuego debido al ruido producido por un tanque, dispararon fatalmente a la que sería la tercera víctima. Así las cosas, las FDI han señalado que, de acuerdo con su análisis de la situación y según imágenes aéreas obtenidas, los tres rehenes estaban sin camiseta y uno de ellos ondeaba una bandera blanca improvisada en el momento en que se acercaban las tropas israelíes. Sin embargo, el militar que abrió fuego tenía una "visión limitada" de la situación. Halevi ha concluido que los disparos a los rehenes "podrían haberse evitado" pero que "no hubo maldad en el evento y los soldados llevaron a cabo la acción correcta según su mejor comprensión de la situación en ese momento". Además, Halevi ha incidido en la "suma importancia de cumplir con los procedimientos operativos" de las FDI. El Ejército de Israel reconoció el pasado 15 de diciembre haber matado por error durante una operación en el barrio de Shejaiya, en el norte de la Franja de Gaza, a tres de los rehenes tomados por Hamás a comienzos de octubre. Las autoridades identificaron a los fallecidos como Yotam Haum, Samer Talalka y Alon Shamriz. El primer ministro israelí, Benjamin Netanyahu, reconoció recibir con "profundo dolor" la "insoportable" noticia y aseguro que, incluso en momentos duros como aquel, Israel aprendería las lecciones y continuaría adelante con sus esfuerzos para liberar a todos los rehenes de Hamás. La milicia palestina lanzó a comienzos de octubre un ataque contra Israel que dejó un balance de casi 1.200 muertos y 240 rehenes. Las FDI respondieron rápidamente con una cruenta contraofensiva contra las estructuras de Hamás en la Franja de Gaza y que deja ya más de 21.300 muertos y otros 55.600 heridos. Noticias relacionadas Siria denuncia un ataque de Israel desde los ocupados Altos del Golán hacia el sur del país Muere un hombre de 38 años por disparos del Ejército israelí al sur de Hebrón, en Cisjordania Maduro ordena "acciones defensivas" ante la llegada de un buque británico a las costas de Guyana Las delegaciones estadounidense y mexicana se citan nuevamente en enero para hablar sobre migración EEUU, Francia, Alemania y Reino Unido condenan que Irán haya acelerado la producción de uranio enriquecido Quiénes somos | Sobre nosotros | Contacto | Aviso legal | | © Diario Siglo XXI. Periódico digital independiente, plural y abierto | Director: Guillermo Peris Peris
